means: （与名词、形容词以及副词构成形容词）受…影响的
鼓舞( inspire的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Jamaica's socialist government is adopting US-inspired free market practices.
sentence.Network_cn: 牙买加的社会主义政府正在仿效美国实行自由市场。

sentence.Network_en: He called Mr Mandela a hero who had inspired millions.
sentence.Network_cn: 他称曼德拉先生为鼓舞了数百万民众的英雄。

sentence.Network_en: Despite his unconventional methods, he has inspired pupils more than anyone else.
sentence.Network_cn: 尽管他的方法不同寻常，但他给予学生的激励比其他人都要多。

entry.def: If someone or something inspires you to do something new or unusual, they make you want to do it.

example.ex: These herbs will inspire you to try out all sorts of exotic-flavoured dishes!...
example.tran: 这些香草会激发你去品尝各种异国风味的菜肴！

example.ex: Our challenge is to motivate those voters and inspire them to join our cause...
example.tran: 我们面临的挑战是如何调动那些选民的积极性并鼓励他们加入我们的事业。

entry.tran: 启发;使产生灵感和热情
entry.def: If someone or something inspires you, they give you new ideas and a strong feeling of enthusiasm.

example.ex: Jimi Hendrix inspired a generation of guitarists.
example.tran: 吉米·亨德里克斯启发了整整一代吉他演奏者。

entry.tran: 作为…的为灵感来源;是…的原型
entry.def: If a book, work of art, or action is inspired by something, that thing is the source of the idea for it.

example.ex: The book was inspired by a real person, namely Tamara de Treaux.
example.tran: 那本书的灵感源于一个真实人物,即塔玛拉·德特罗。

example.ex: ...a political murder inspired by the same nationalist conflicts now wrecking the country.
example.tran: 正是由正在毁掉该国的民族主义冲突激发的一起政治谋杀

entry.tran: 激起，唤起(某种感情或反应)
entry.def: Someone or something that inspires a particular emotion or reaction in people makes them feel this emotion or reaction.

example.ex: The car's performance quickly inspires confidence.
example.tran: 该汽车的性能会很快唤起驾驶者的信心。

means.word_mean: 1. of such surpassing excellence as to suggest divine inspiration;

auth_sentence.content: Butt's direction is generally sound, sometimes inspired.
auth_sentence.res_content: Butt's direction is generally sound, sometimes inspired.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Butt's direction is generally sound, sometimes inspired.

auth_sentence.content: This is an inspired approach and a powerful model.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is an inspired approach and a powerful model.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is an inspired approach and a powerful model.

auth_sentence.content: Inspired by the shape of his children's Mr.
auth_sentence.res_content: Inspired by the shape of his children's Mr.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Inspired by the shape of his children's Mr.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表示"向内,成为,进入,使……"; 2. 表示"不,无,非"

stems_affixes.word_buile: in向内,成为,进入,使……+born出生的→adj.天生的
in向内,成为,进入,使……+cent唱歌+ive……的→把精神唱进去→激励
in向内,成为,进入,使……+cis=cise切+ive……的→切入→入木三分
in向内,成为,进入,使……+door门→门内的
in向内,成为,进入,使……+spir呼吸+ed的→有呼吸的→有生命的
in不,无,非+visible看得见的→adj.看不见的, 无形的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 效率低的, 效率差的
stems_affixes.word_buile: in不,无,非+efficient有效的→adj.效率低的, 效率差的
in不,无,非+accurate正确的→adj.错误的, 不准确的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 无行动的, 不活动的
stems_affixes.word_buile: in不,无,非+active积极的→adj.无行动的, 不活动的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不充分的, 不适当的
stems_affixes.word_buile: in不,无,非+adequate足够的→adj.不充分的, 不适当的
in不,无,非+calculable可计算的→adj.不可计算的
in不,无,非+capable有能力的→adj.无能力的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不完全的, 不完善的
stems_affixes.word_buile: in不,无,非+complete完全的,圆满的→adj.不完全的, 不完善的
in不,无,非+constant稳定的→adj.多变的,无常的
in不,无,非+convenient便利的→adj.不便的, 有困难的
in不,无,非+corrigible可改正的→adj.积习难改的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不明确的;不定的,模糊的
stems_affixes.word_buile: in不,无,非+definite明确的→adj.不明确的;不定的,模糊的
in不,无,非+different不同的→同与不同的"事不关已"→冷漠的
in不,无,非+dign高贵+ant……的→[因发脾气]不高贵的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不可避免的, 必然的
stems_affixes.word_buile: in不,无,非+evitable可避免的→adj.不可避免的, 必然的
in不,无,非+human人道的→adj.不人道的
in不,无,非+imit模仿+able可以……的→不能模仿的
in不,无,非+justice公正→adj.不公正
in不,无,非+noc毒害+ous……的→无害的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 无意义的,低微的,微不足道的
stems_affixes.word_buile: in不,无,非+significant有意义的→adj.无意义的,低微的,微不足道的
in不,无,非+glor光荣+ious……的→不光荣的
in不,无,非+temperate自制的→adj.放纵的
in不,无,非+variable易变的;变量→adj.不变的, 永恒的 n.不变量
indoor[adj.户内的]+s→adv.在户内
in向内,成为,进入,使……+curs跑+ion表名词→跑入→侵犯
in不,无,非+accuracy准确→n.错误
in不,无,非+difference不同→不不同→没什么不同,没什么了不起→冷漠,无足轻重
indifference[n. 不关心,冷漠,无足轻重]→n.漠不关心, 不在乎
in不,无,非+stability稳定→n.不稳定[性]
in不,无,非+significance意义→n.无意义
in不,无,非+variable易变的;变量→adj.不变的, 永恒的 n.不变量
in向内,成为,进入,使……+put放→n.&v.输入
in向内,成为,进入,使……+augur=augury预兆,开始+ate表动词→进入开始→就职;参考:augury预兆
in向内,成为,进入,使……+corpor团体+ate表动词→v.合并
in向内,成为,进入,使……+flame火焰→v.使燃烧;激怒
in向内,成为,进入,使……+hale气→进气,吸气
in向内,成为,进入,使……+vigor活力+ate表动词→v.鼓舞,激励

Sentence.sentence: He was inspired by the way the wares were displayed.
The personality ethic suggested it was one's attitude, not behavior, that inspired success, and this ethic was founded on a belief of positive mental attitude.
We suspect they felt inspired and energised by his victory, so the stereotype threat wouldn't prove a distraction," says Friedman.
